meanings.definition: Past tense of swear falsely or perjuriously.
meanings.sent1: He unswore his testimony in court.
meanings.sent2: She unswore her allegiance to the king.
meanings.sent3: The parrot unswore its vow of silence by squawking loudly.
meanings.sent4: The politician unswore his campaign promises as soon as he was elected.
meanings.sent5: The villain unswore his loyalty to the evil queen, betraying her in the end.

meanings.definition: To retract or take back an oath or promise.
meanings.sent1: They unswore their pact to always be friends.
meanings.sent2: After much thought, he unswore his vow of silence.
meanings.sent3: The magician unswore his promise to never reveal his tricks, much to the audience's delight.
meanings.sent4: The waves unswore their eternal dance with the shore, pulling back in a fierce storm.
meanings.sent5: The old tree unswore its commitment to stand tall, bending gracefully in the wind.
